info.title: Adding modules and extensions after installation

section.title: Introduction
section.para: Even after a system is installed and registered, you can still add modules and extensions by using &yast; or SUSEConnect.

listitem.para: You have installed your product and your system is up and running.
Your product is registered at the &scc; or an &rmt; server.
You have a valid registration code for any extensions you want to add.

step.para: Start &yast; and select Software System Extensions.
To add modules or extensions, select all components you want to install. Note that all extensions require additional registration codes which are liable for cost.
All additional components are registered with the registration server and the associated repositories are added to your system.

The &yast; package installer opens to install release-packages for each module and, depending on your choice of modules and extensions, additional packages. It is strongly recommended not to deselect any of the preselected packages; you may, however, add additional packages.
Choose Accept and Finish to conclude the process.

tip.title: Module dependencies
tip.para: Similar to software packages, which may depend on other packages to function, a module may have dependencies on other modules. If this is the case, the modules on which it depends are automatically selected for installation.

section.title: Adding modules and extensions from the command line

step.para: Run SUSEConnect -list-extensions to get an overview of available modules and extensions. You will see output similar to the following:
step.screen:
&prompt.user;sudo SUSEConnect -list-extensions AVAILABLE EXTENSIONS AND MODULES
Basesystem Module &product-ga; SP&product-sp; x86_64 (Activated) Deactivate with: SUSEConnect -d -p sle-module-basesystem/&productnumbershort;/x86_64
SUSE Cloud Application Platform Tools Module &product-ga; SP&product-sp; x86_64 Activate with: SUSEConnect -p sle-module-cap-tools/&productnumbershort;/x86_64
SUSE Package Hub &product-ga; SP&product-sp; x86_64 Activate with: SUSEConnect -p PackageHub/&productnumbershort;/x86_64
[...]

step.para: Run the commands in the listing for activating a module or extension to add a component. Note that adding extensions requires additional registration codes which are liable for cost.

important.title: No automated installation of packages
important.para: When using SUSEConnect to add modules and extensions, the default packages or patterns are not automatically installed. You must install them manually with Zypper on the command line, or by starting &yast; and selecting Software Software Management.

section.title: Summary
section.para: All added components are registered with the registration server and the associated repositories are added to your system.
If you used the command line, the packages that belong to the module or extension are not installed automatically. You must manually install packages with Zypper or &yast;.
